txt.en: DNT soldier will be there ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Mulnír
Everyone is gathered in a solemn circle
'I will be there.'
Mulnír has asked you to speak to gather the men around the Foothold in Udûn, and tell them where to meet.
'Yes, I will go.'
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nListen to Barathron speak.
'Of course. I will see you there.'
'Fine. We will do this and then we will be done with him.'
Lay Lachír's belongings down
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nYou should lay the Captain's belongings in the middle of the circle of mourners.
Collected Lachír's book
DNT 'Perhaps what made him so great in battle... made him such a terrible leader.'
DNT listen to soldier b
Collected Lachír's pack
Collected Lachír's flagon
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nYou should talk to Mulnír again.
<rgb=#FF00FF>Listen</rgb> to Barathron
DNT place teh items in the circle

'Something must be done. We have no captain now and many lives have been lost. There are customs and rites to be observed - or are we not on the same perilous road he went down?

'We have no captain and so we will all stand about unless someone begins. Yes, there we have it.

'Will you help me once more, friend? Gather the men and what belongings of Lachír's you can find. We will meet on the high platform across the road. It is as good a spot as any.'
You should talk to Mulnír on the platform where the men have gathered to mourn Captain Lachír, across the road from the Foothold in Udûn.
DNT
DNT take part in teh ceremony
A Solemn Gathering
Talk to the soldiers ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

Mulnír clears his throat, thinks for a moment, and begins.

'We all followed our Captain into battle. Beside him, we feared nothing and we risked all bravely, gladly, and with true honour. Whatever befell us in the last few days, let that not be forgotten.

'[placeholder], you have his effects?'

'Tales of Old Gondor, it was. Oft around a camp-fire he would read out of it. Do you remember? Such fine old kings and warriors. Their weapons bore names and their raiments shone. Their deeds were great, their words were poetry, and their deaths brought tears to the eye.\n\n'Perhaps that is what old Lachír wanted for himself. In some way it was like that, was it not? And yet unlike, too. Makes you wonder if the men in those old tales felt themselves in a book... or felt something more as we feel now.'
'DNT this is all we have left of him and the comrades he led to death.'
Collect the Captain's belongings ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nHear Othras' memory of Lachír.
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nHear Coldan's memory of Lachír.
Talk to Mulnír
The mourners are gathered on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.\n\nYou should mourn with the others.
Talk to Othras
'DNT we are here to mourn Lachír.'
'I would say a word.'
Talk to Coldan
'He never let a soul drink from that flagon.'
'Aye, but the odour from it was something fierce.'
<rgb=#FF00FF>Mourn</rgb> with the others
All observe a grave, momentary silence
'The book, though... that book.'
'Well spoken, Coldan.'
'So it was. So it was.'
You should return to the Foothold in Udûn now that the gathering to remember Lachír is over.
'Let us mourn together.'
Mulnír looks as if he has one last thing to say to you
'Aye, 'tis so.'
The remaining men of the Udûn Foothold must come to terms with Captain Lachír's end.
'Truly this is a place of warping madness.'
You should talk to Mulnír in the Foothold camp in Udûn.
'Hhhem!'
DNT 'So sad. So true.'
Mulnír has asked you to collect what personal belongings of Captain Lachír you could find around the Foothold camp in Udûn.

'Without your help, [placeholder], all this would have gone - well, more poorly than it has. I know well enough that our mourning is not truly ended, but we cannot linger on it.\n\n'Please, accept our thanks. Do not you linger, either.'
Return to the Foothold
'Across the road? Yes, you have my word.'
'My heart is full sore with many things, but I will go.'
'We owe him that, at least.'
Talk to Mulnír
You should meet Mulnír and the other men up on the high platform across the road from the Udûn Foothold.

'I deem that a proper rite for our lost captain. He died as he lived, sword in hand. We shall not forget him, but the empty space he leaves will not long stay vacant, I think. A new captain will likely be sent down, and with no great delay.\n\n'If we wish to stay in good graces, we had best return to camp and see that all is returned to order. But that is on your own head, for I am no captain, not today and not tomorrow.'
Meet across the road

'It is too easy by far to forget the Lachír we knew, just as Mulnír said. The one who led us into battle and was ever our protector and companion. That Lachír and the one we knew here, who strayed on foot and in reason from the path... from every path... I feel that they are the same man.

'For perhaps there was always some madness in his nature. Perhaps the dreams that lived in the old tales of Gondor led us bravely to war and then vainly, ruinously through the wreckage of Udûn.

'And before we condemn him in his memory, perhaps we should look within our own hearts and wonder what dreams and what in our own natures has been twisted and made monstrous by this place. Truly, perhaps it is only our humble stations that have kept each other of us from doing greater harm.'
DNT 'That's all he left behind?'
